docs.snippet: James Franco's mother and grandmother have joined the promotional crusade to promote this year's Oscars telecast....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Franco family once again surprises with its industriousness. As part of the Oscars' feel-good, please-just-watch, "You're Invited" campaign for this year's awards show, the producers have convinced some of the mothers of nominees to use Twitter.
docs.abstract: James Franco's mother and grandmother have joined the promotional crusade to promote this year's Oscars telecast.

docs.snippet: In the last few days, several pieces by the British street artist Banksy have appeared around the Los Angeles area: a urinating dog, a mischievous Charlie Brown and a drunk Mickey and Minnie Mouse, with the slogan "Living the Dream."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Banksy has made it to Hollywood, or at least some of his work has. In the last few days, several pieces by the British street artist have appeared around Los Angeles: a urinating dog (placed in Beverly Hills), a mischievous Charlie Brown and a drunk Mickey and Minnie Mouse, with the slogan "Living the Dream." (All the images are viewable on Banksy's Web site.) Though Banksy's reps confirmed to The Los Angeles Times that the work belonged to him, they did not mention whether it was part of his ongoing un-campaign for his Oscar-nominated documentary, "Exit Through the Gift Shop." But since Banksy rarely does anything without it being carefully thought out, we can assume it's more than a coincidence.
docs.abstract: In the last few days, several pieces by the British street artist Banksy have appeared around the Los Angeles area: a urinating dog, a mischievous Charlie Brown and a drunk Mickey and Minnie Mouse, with the slogan "Living the Dream."

headline.main: Banksy Sightings in Hollywood (of a Sort)

docs.snippet: Rachid Bouchareb, the Franco-Algerian director of "Outside the Law," talks about juggling multiple identities and the controversy surrounding his Oscar-nominated film....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Franco-Algerian director Rachid Bouchareb has got to be hoping that the third time is the charm. He received Oscar nominations for best foreign-language film in 1996 for his "Dust of Life" and again in 2007 for "Days of Glory," both of which are films that tackle difficult aspects of the relationship between the West and the Third World. And now he is back with "Outside the Law," which addresses the long and violent struggle in which Algeria sought its independence from France, finally achieved in 1962.
docs.abstract: Rachid Bouchareb, the Franco-Algerian director of "Outside the Law," talks about juggling multiple identities and the controversy surrounding his Oscar-nominated film.

headline.main: A Chat With the Man Behind 'Outside the Law'

docs.snippet: This year, the Oscar envelope, which in previous years came from Staples, will be designed by a high-end Los Angeles-based stationary designer....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- It's the equivalent of discovering that the Oscar statuettes are purchased at Spencer's Gifts. The sealed envelopes used at the Academy Awards apparently come from . . . Staples.
docs.abstract: This year, the Oscar envelope, which in previous years came from Staples, will be designed by a high-end Los Angeles-based stationary designer.

headline.main: The Oscar Envelope Gets a Makeover

docs.snippet: Opulence has only just begun to re-emerge in fashion, after the dark years, though it never really left the runway of Oscar de la Renta....
docs.lead_paragraph: The price of gold at the time of Oscar de la Renta's show today was hovering around $1,375 an ounce. It occurred to me that if I could somehow melt down his collection, I could probably afford to retire.
docs.abstract: Opulence has only just begun to re-emerge in fashion, after the dark years, though it never really left the runway of Oscar de la Renta.
